dt: {bc}to ascertain the heaviness of by or as if by a balance
{bc}to consider carefully especially by balancing opposing factors or aspects in order to reach a choice or conclusion {bc}{sx|evaluate||}
{bc}to heave up (an anchor) preparatory to sailing
{bc}to measure or apportion (a definite quantity) on or as if on a scales
{bc}to have a certain heaviness {bc}experience a specific force due to gravity
{bc}to press down with or as if with a heavy weight
{bc}to have a saddening or disheartening effect

pt: {sc}consider{/sc} {sc}study{/sc} {sc}contemplate{/sc} {sc}weigh{/sc} mean to think about in order to arrive at a judgment or decision. {sc}consider{/sc} may suggest giving thought to in order to reach a suitable conclusion, opinion, or decision.
{sc}study{/sc} implies sustained purposeful concentration and attention to details and minutiae.
{sc}contemplate{/sc} stresses focusing one's thoughts on something but does not imply coming to a conclusion or decision.
{sc}weigh{/sc} implies attempting to reach the truth or arrive at a decision by balancing conflicting claims or evidence.

pt.t: {it}weigh{/it} the pros and cons of the case

et: Middle English {it}weyen{/it}, from Old English {it}wegan{/it} to move, carry, weigh {ma}{mat|way|}{/ma}
shortdef: to ascertain the heaviness of by or as if by a balance
to cause to bend down : overburden

dt: {bc}to have oneself or one's possessions (such as baggage) weighed
{bc}to have oneself weighed in connection with an athletic contest
{bc}to bring one's weight or influence to bear especially as a participant, contributor, or mediator

shortdef: to have oneself or one's possessions (such as baggage) weighed; especially : to have oneself weighed in connection with an athletic contest
to bring one's weight or influence to bear especially as a participant, contributor, or mediator

dt: {bc}to make (someone or something) sad, depressed, or worried

dt.t: The bad news is really {it}weighing on{/it} me.
I can tell that something is {phrase}weighing on his mind{/phrase}.

shortdef: to make (someone or something) sad, depressed, or worried

dt: {bc}to measure and remove a certain weight of (something) {bc}to separate (a portion of something that weighs a certain amount)

dt.t: Would you {it}weigh out{/it} 20 pounds of rice?
I {it}weighed{/it} the portions {it}out{/it} and distributed them.

shortdef: to measure and remove a certain weight of (something) : to separate (a portion of something that weighs a certain amount)

dt: {bc}to look at and listen to (someone) in order to make a judgment about that person's character, abilities, etc.

dt.t: She was watching him closely as he spoke, {it}weighing{/it} him {it}up{/it}.

shortdef: to look at and listen to (someone) in order to make a judgment about that person's character, abilities, etc.
